result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L. Fink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond previously posted in the amount of $500 has been applied. Remaining costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with J. Ralls and/or S. Jensen directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Sentence to commence forthwith.

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.
Same conditions as noted in Count 1 with the exception of the jail time.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with Count 1.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L. Fink

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 11:18 a.m. Defendant Jeremy L. Fink in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Defendant Jeremy L. Fink in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. The parties stipulate to 106 days CFTS. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Gardner. Statement by DE. Court orders: 8 mos WC Jail as to each count concurrent - Huber, GT, 106 days CFTS - Balance to be served forthwith. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 19, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Case called @ 3:37 p.m. Defendant Jeremy L. Fink in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 3 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Gardner. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 18 mos Probation - Conditions: As to Count 1 only - 10 days WC Jail - Huber, NO GT, 6 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than November 1, 2016 - the Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.  As to both counts - NC w/ J. Ralls and/or S. Jenson, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, defendant may not be present upon the premises of any bars, defendant is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA and follow through, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal rights given. Bond previously posted to be applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Garnder requests additional status as defendant has additional charges in Wood County-requests plea in approximately 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court appears telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gardner requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on July 19, 2016 at 02:40 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from making any service calls for his employment unless in the direct presence of another member of the company.
Defendant and Atty Gardner appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 1:19 p.m. Defendant Jeremy L. Fink in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Robert A. Gardner.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Gardner requesting a signature bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 02:40 pm.

Case Called @ 2:17 PM: Defendant Jeremy L. Fink in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
